claim: The Formula 1 race held on 2015/11/29 experienced a brief power outage in the paddock before the start.
extra_info: game and race are synonyms; drivers who finished the race should have record in time;
reasoning: The claim references a 'brief power outage in the paddock before the start,' which is an operational/logistical event. The database schema contains only race results data (races, results, drivers, circuits, pit stops, lap times, qualifying, etc.) and has no tables or columns tracking paddock incidents, power outages, or any pre-race operational events. This is an out-of-schema concept that cannot be verified or refuted from the available data.

content.text:
I need to analyze this claim carefully before querying the database.

The claim states: "The Formula 1 race held on 2015/11/29 experienced a brief power outage in the paddock before the start."

This claim has two parts:
1. There was a Formula 1 race on 2015/11/29
2. There was a "brief power outage in the paddock before the start"

The second part — a "power outage in the paddock" — is an operational/logistical event that would not typically be stored in a race results database. Let me check the schema to confirm.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
circuits              drivers               results             
constructorResults    lapTimes              seasons             
constructorStandings  pitStops              status              
constructors          qualifying          
driverStandings       races

tool_use_result.stdout:
circuits              drivers               results             
constructorResults    lapTimes              seasons             
constructorStandings  pitStops              status              
constructors          qualifying          
driverStandings       races

content.content:
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

content.text:
The database schema contains tables for races, results, drivers, circuits, pit stops, lap times, qualifying, etc. — all standard race result data. There is no table or column related to "power outages," "paddock incidents," or any operational/logistical events.

The claim about a "brief power outage in the paddock before the start" references a concept that is entirely outside the scope of this database schema. This is an **out-of-schema** claim.
